column4: I installed grub 2 after I finished the install. then I did grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg and grub_bios-install --grub-setup=/bin/true --boot-directory=/boot --no-floppy --recheck /dev/sda and they did fine too. after that I rebooted and i got error: symbol not found. 'grub_divmod64_full'  Entering rescue mode ...  grub rescue> i removed grub2 by pacman and install it again and I did the process again and I get the same error. I
Yes I know but the ubuntu is the only one with the same problem mines the UUID part and archiz send me here please help
I can't help, and most of people here don't use Arch so honestly dunno
I don't know how to fix it on Ubuntu either (if I'd know at all, I'd likely know how to fix it on Arch, actually)
If you have Arch, you just modify the DAEMONS=() array in rc.conf. As for Ubuntu, "man update-rc.d"
Got nothing to do with inittab.
And, ThinkT510 is right. Arch uses a BSD-style SystemD boot system. It's TOTALLY different, and Ubuntu people will *not* be able to help you with that.
Sooo? You're not asking for lightdm help
You're asking for systemd help, which is not only *not* an Ubuntu project, but even totally unsupported in Ubuntu.
you mean for inittab option i need systemd installed
